707202f-a.text:
Vermont Street, west side, north of Atlantic Ave. The Ardley Palace (an amusement hall) on the S.W. corner is partly visible because of the Long Island R.R. structure.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
707202f-a.folder: Vermont St. & Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY

703068f-a.text:
(1)
2684-2692 Atlantic Ave., at the S.W. corner of Vermont Street, showing a hotel owned by Mrs. Schiellein in 1873, which at a later date was the property of Judge Emil Schiellein. In 1922 it was known as Congress Hall.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing Congress Hall, now known as Ardley Palace. Also shown is the south side of Atlantic Ave., to New Jersey Ave. Overhead is a partial view of the Long Island R.R. structure.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703068f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Vermont Street, Brooklyn, NY
